main event: A C-47 type aircraft of the California Air National Guard observed a cigar-shaped object in the sky near Arlington, California for approximately 15 minutes.
interesting points: The object was metallic, silver in color, estimated to be 75-100 feet long and 15-20 feet in diameter, with no exhaust, fins, or wings.

A student who was an amateur astronomer observed a bright object that moved in a straight line across the horizon for 4-5 seconds, varying in size from a half-dollar to slightly larger than a dollar bill.
The student believed the object was a meteor, but he had never seen one at such close range before.
Another witness saw a bright orangish-yellow object traveling from west to east, with a tail that changed color from orange to red to blue.
The investigations concluded that there was insufficient data to evaluate the sightings.
sighted object: cigar-shaped metallic object, bright object moving across the horizon
witnesses: C-47 aircraft crew, student amateur astronomer, another unidentified witness
